request.description:
create a user in the database and saves its data

note : username has to be a unique value

- Handle the login process, and if it succeeds, respond with a message  
    indicating successful login and include two tokens: a refresh token sent  
    in a cookie and an access token in the response data.
    
- The access token should be included in the response data, while the refresh token should  
    be sent in a cookie.
    
- Ensure to include the user's device type in the URL parameters. If the user is accessing the website, set the device parameter to "web", causing the refresh token to expire after 2 days. otherwise then user uses the mobile application and the refresh token will not expire.

create an otp (one time password) and sends email contains this otp to the user's email and save the otp in the database with 30 minutes expiration date and number of tries with zero value

note : you will get the user id because you will send it in verify otp request

- check that otp is correct and valid
- the user can try to send otp 3 times if he excceeded 3 times the otp will be invalid and get deleted from database
- the otp has 30 minutes expiration time and if user sends otp after that time, otp will be invalid and deleted from database
    
- the response contains user id because you will send it with create new password request

response.name: otp becomes invalid

request.description:
- set validation on password and confirm password
    
- updates user password

- Generation access token and that's because the expiration date of access token is 15 minute and to prevent user to login again
    
- Refresh Token should be sent in cookie and if the user uses the website the refresh token will expire after 2 days and if user uses the mobile application the refresh token will not expire

header.value: refreshToken=; Path=/api/v1/newToken; Expires=Thu, 01 Jan 1970 00:00:00 GMT; HttpOnly; SameSite=Strict

request.description: Get all images for every page and the rate of fetching is 2 images per page
Get a single image by passing the image id in the url query parameters
Get all images for the chosen caterogy
Retrieve all images whose names contain the search term entered by the user
saves the image data to the related user into the database

- get all images ordered by their price
    
- the images are divided into pages and you have to specify the page number in query parameters
    
- if order in query parameters equals to asc, then the cheapest images will be fetched
    
- and if the order in query parameters equals to desc, then the most expensive images will be fetched

response.name: cheapest images in the first page
most expensive images in the first page

delete the user from database and delete all the data that is related to this user
get all images that was added to the cart in addition to the total price of these images

create a user's cart if not created and add the image to the cart and update the total price for the cart

note : if the user tries to add an existed image to the cart, the response will be a message says that image already is existing in the cart
delete the image from the cart and updates the total price of images in the cart
delete the user's cart in addition to the images in this cart
create a payment intent using stripe api and retrieve the client secret for this user
